reasoning: Reporting incidence of new gout diagnoses. Population-based studies from UK and US (2000-2005) show incidence ~1.5 per 1000 person-years (150 per 100k), higher in men and increasing with age.
source: Arromdee E et al. (2002). Epidemiology of gout: is the incidence rising? J Rheumatol. 29(11):2403-6
